title: Solemnity: Mary, Mother of God (Octave of Christmas)

readings.label: Alleluia

readings.text: Mary kept all these things, reflecting on them in her heart.

readings.text: The leprosy left him immediately.

readings.label: Alleluia

readings.text: The word of God is living and effective.

readings.label: Alleluia

readings.label: Alleluia

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Your word is a lamp for my feet, a light for my path.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The measure with which you measure will be measured out to you.

readings.label: Alleluia

readings.label: Gospel

readings.label: Gospel

readings.text: Jesus preached the Gospel of the Kingdom.

readings.text: Blessed are those who fear the Lord.

readings.text: The Holy Spirit will teach you everything.

readings.text: For saying this, you may go. The demon has gone out of your daughter.

readings.text: My sheep hear my voice, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: They ate and were satisfied.

title: Feast: Sixth Sunday in Ordinary Time (Sunday)

readings.label: Alleluia

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you.

readings.text: Offer to God a sacrifice of praise.

readings.text: I am the light of the world, says the Lord.

readings.text: No sign will be given to this generation.

readings.text: The Lord saw how great was man's wickedness on earth.

readings.text: The Lord will bless his people with peace.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: My sheep hear my voice, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Do you still not understand?

readings.text: Noah built an altar to the Lord.

readings.label: Psalm

readings.text: I am the way and the truth and the life.

readings.text: The Lord looked down from his holy height.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Repent, and believe in the Gospel.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: You are the Christ.

title: Feast: Ordinary Weekday/Peter Damian, Bishop, Doctor

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: The whole world spoke the same language.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Blessed the people the Lord has chosen to be his own.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Whoever loves me will keep my word.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Whoever loses his life for my sake will save it.

title: Feast: Chair of Peter, Apostle Feast

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Tend the flock of God in your midst.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord is my shepherd; there is nothing I shall want.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: You are Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.

title: Feast: Seventh Sunday in Ordinary Time (Sunday)

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: You shall love your neighbor as yourself.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord is kind and merciful.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: You are the temple of God.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Whoever keeps the word of Christ, the love of God is truly perfected in him.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Love your enemies.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Consider it all joy when you encounter various trials.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Teach me wisdom and knowledge, for in your commands I trust.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: My sheep hear my voice, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: I do believe, help my unbelief!

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Blessed is the man who perseveres in temptation.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord will not cast off his people.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Humbly welcome the word that has been planted in you.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: If anyone wishes to be first, he shall be the last of all.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Be doers of the word and not hearers only.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: He who does justice will live in the presence of the Lord.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I give you a new commandment: love one another.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Whoever is not against us is for us.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Show no partiality as you adhere to the faith.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord hears the cry of the poor.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Blessed are the poor in spirit; the kingdom of heaven is theirs!

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: If your hand causes you to sin, cut it off.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Faith without works is dead.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Blessed the man who fears the Lord.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Whoever loves me will keep my word.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: What God has joined together, no human being must separate.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: God created man and gave him dominion over all things.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord's kindness is everlasting to those who fear him.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Blessed are you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Let the children come to me.

title: Feast: Eighth Sunday in Ordinary Time (Sunday)

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: I will allure her and speak tenderly to her.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord is kind and merciful.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: Our competence comes from God.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Whoever loves me will keep my word.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Do not worry about tomorrow.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Give to the Most High as he has given to you.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: To him that goes the right way I will show the salvation of God.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Whoever loves me will keep my word.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Go, sell what you have, and follow me.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: I sought wisdom openly in my prayer.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: You are my inheritance, O Lord.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Whoever loves me will keep my word.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Many that are first will be last, and the last will be first.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Remember that I stood before you to speak in their behalf.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Save me, O Lord, in your kindness.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I am the light of the world, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The Son of Man did not come to be served but to serve.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Blessed is the man who trusts in the Lord.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Blessed are they who hope in the Lord.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Blessed are they who have kept the word with a generous heart.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: You received what was good during your lifetime.

title: Feast: Ordinary Weekday/Perpetua and Felicity, Martyrs

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Joseph's brothers sold him to the Ishmaelites.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Remember the marvels the Lord has done.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: God so loved the world that he gave his only Son.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.

title: Feast: Ordinary Weekday/John of God, Religious

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: You will cast into the depths of the sea all our sins.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord is kind and merciful.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I will get up and go to my father and shall say to him: Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: There will be joy in heaven over one sinner who repents.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: The Lord God formed man from the dust of the ground.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Be merciful, O Lord, for we have sinned.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: Where sin increased, grace overflowed all the more.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: One does not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes forth from the mouth of God.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Jesus fasted for forty days and was tempted.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: You shall love your neighbor as yourself.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Your words, Lord, are Spirit and life.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Behold, now is a very acceptable time; behold, now is the day of salvation.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Whatever you did for one of these least brothers of mine, you did for me.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: My word shall not return to me void.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: From all their distress God rescues the just.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: One does not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes forth from the mouth of God.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: If you forgive others, your heavenly Father will forgive you.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: The people of Nineveh believed God; they proclaimed a fast.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: A heart contrite and humbled, O God, you will not spurn.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Return to me with your whole heart, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: At the judgment the men of Nineveh will arise with this generation and condemn it.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Queen Esther appeals to the Lord for help.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Lord, on the day I called for help, you answered me.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: A clean heart create for me, O God.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Do to others whatever you would have them do to you.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: If the wicked man turns away from all his sins, he shall surely live.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: If you, O Lord, mark iniquities, who can stand?

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Cast away from you all the crimes you have committed, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Go first and be reconciled with your brother.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: You will be a people sacred to the Lord.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Blessed are they who follow the law of the Lord!

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Behold, now is a very acceptable time; behold, now is the day of salvation.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: The Lord said to Abram: Go forth from your land.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Lord, let your mercy be on us, as we place our trust in you.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: God has called us to a holy life.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: This is my beloved Son, hear him.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: His face shone like the sun.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: We have sinned, been wicked and done evil.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Lord, do not deal with us according to our sins.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Your words, Lord, are Spirit and life; you have the words of everlasting life.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Forgive, and you will be forgiven.

title: Feast: Lent Weekday/Cyril of Jerusalem, Bishop, Doctor

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Though your sins be like scarlet, they may become white as snow.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: To him that goes the right way I will show the salvation of God.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Cast away from you all the crimes you have committed, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The greatest among you must be your servant.

title: Solemnity: Joseph, Spouse of the Blessed Virgin Mary

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: The Lord will give him the throne of David.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The son of David will live for ever.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: He is father of all who believe.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Blessed are those who dwell in your house, O Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Joseph did as the angel of the Lord had commanded him.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: This is the nation that does not listen to the voice of the Lord.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: If today you hear his voice, harden not your hearts.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Return to me with your whole heart, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Whoever is not with me is against me.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: I will heal their defection, says the Lord.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: I am the Lord your God: hear my voice.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Repent, says the Lord; the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Love the Lord your God with all your heart.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: For it is love that I desire, not sacrifice.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: It is steadfast love, not sacrifice, that pleases God.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: If today you hear his voice, harden not your hearts.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The one who humbles himself will be exalted.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Strike the rock, and the water will flow from it.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: If today you hear his voice, harden not your hearts.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: The love of God has been poured out into our hearts.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Lord, you are truly the Savior of the world; give me living water, that I may never thirst again.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The water that I shall give will become a spring of eternal life.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Naaman's flesh became like the flesh of a little child.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Athirst is my soul for the living God.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I hope in the Lord, I trust in his word.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: No prophet is accepted in his own native place.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: The virgin shall be with child and bear a son.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Here am I, Lord; I come to do your will.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: Behold, I come to do your will, O God.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: The Word became flesh and made his dwelling among us; and we saw his glory.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Behold, you will conceive in your womb and bear a son.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Observe these statutes that you may live.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Praise the Lord, Jerusalem.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Your words, Lord, are Spirit and life; you have the words of everlasting life.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: I have come not to abolish but to fulfill.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: This is the nation that does not listen to the voice of the Lord.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: If today you hear his voice, harden not your hearts.

readings.text: Return to me with your whole heart, says the Lord.

readings.text: Whoever is not with me is against me.

readings.text: I will heal their defection, says the Lord.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: I am the Lord your God: hear my voice.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Repent, says the Lord; the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Love the Lord your God with all your heart.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: For it is love that I desire, not sacrifice.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: It is steadfast love, not sacrifice, that pleases God.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: If today you hear his voice, harden not your hearts.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The one who humbles himself will be exalted.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: The Lord looks into the heart.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord is my shepherd; there is nothing I shall want.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: Awake, O sleeper, and arise from the dead.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I am the light of the world, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The man who was blind went off and washed himself and came back able to see.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: I create new heavens and a new earth.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: I will praise you, Lord, for you have rescued me.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Seek good and not evil so that you may live, and the Lord will be with you.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The royal official believed what Jesus said and left.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: God called me from birth, formed me as his servant.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: In you, O Lord, I take refuge.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Blessed are they who have kept the word with a generous heart.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will realize that I AM.

title: Feast: Ordinary Weekday/Francis of Paola, Hermit

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: The Lord God is my help, therefore I am not disgraced.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Lord, in your great love, answer me.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I hope in the Lord, I trust in his word.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: If you remain in my word, you will truly be my disciples.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Turn from your blazing anger; relent in punishing your people.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Remember us, O Lord, as you favor your people.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: If today you hear his voice, harden not your hearts.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Before Abraham came to be, I AM.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: The Lord is with me, like a mighty champion.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: In my distress I called upon the Lord.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: The teacher is here and is asking for you.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: If I do not perform my Father's works, do not believe me.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: I will make them one nation upon the land.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord will guard us, as a shepherd guards his flock.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I take no pleasure in the death of the wicked, but rather that they turn from their ways and live.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Many of the Jews who had come to Mary began to believe in Jesus.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: I will open your graves and have you rise from them.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: With the Lord there is mercy and fullness of redemption.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: If the Spirit of the one who raised Jesus from the dead dwells in you, you will live.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I am the resurrection and the life, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Lazarus, come out!

title: Feast: Ordinary Weekday/John Baptist de la Salle, Priest

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Susanna's innocence is vindicated by Daniel.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Though I walk in the dark valley, I fear no evil.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I hope in the Lord, I trust in his word.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Let the one among you who is without sin be the first to throw a stone.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: The Lord said to Moses: Make a seraph and mount it on a pole.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: O Lord, hear my prayer, and let my cry come to you.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: God so loved the world that he gave his only Son.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will realize that I AM.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Can a mother forget her infant?

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord is gracious and merciful.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Your words, Lord, are Spirit and life.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The Father has given all judgment to the Son.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Turn from your blazing anger; relent in punishing your people.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Remember us, O Lord, as you favor your people.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Everyone who believes in the Son has eternal life.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The works the Father gave me to accomplish bear witness to me.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: I will put my spirit in you that you may live.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: O give thanks to the Lord, for he is good.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Behold, I am the handmaid of the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Lazarus, come out!

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Can a mother forget her infant?

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord is gracious and merciful.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Your words, Lord, are Spirit and life.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The Father has given all judgment to the Son.

title: Feast: Palm Sunday of the Lord's Passion (Sunday)

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: I gave my back to those who beat me.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: He humbled himself, becoming obedient to death.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Christ became obedient to the point of death, even death on a cross.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The Passion of our Lord Jesus Christ.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Here is my servant whom I uphold.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord is my light and my salvation.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I give you a new commandment: love one another.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Mary anointed the feet of Jesus.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: God called me from birth, formed me as his servant.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: In you, O Lord, I take refuge.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I give you a new commandment: love one another.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: One of you will betray me.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: The Lord God is my help, therefore I am not disgraced.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Lord, in your great love, answer me.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: One of you will betray me.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The Son of Man goes as it is written of him.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: This day shall be a memorial feast for you.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Our blessing-cup is a communion with the Blood of Christ.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: Do this in remembrance of me.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I give you a new commandment: love one another.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Jesus washes the disciples' feet.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: He was pierced for our offenses.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Father, into your hands I commend my spirit.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: He learned obedience from what he suffered.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Christ became obedient to the point of death, even death on a cross.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The Passion of our Lord Jesus Christ.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Lord, send out your Spirit, and renew the face of the earth.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: Abraham's faith is tested.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: You are my inheritance, O Lord.

readings.label: Third Reading
readings.text: The Israelites cross the Red Sea.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Let us sing to the Lord; he has covered himself in glory.

readings.label: Fourth Reading
readings.text: With enduring love, the Lord takes pity on you.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: I will praise you, Lord, for you have rescued me.

readings.label: Fifth Reading
readings.text: Come to me that you may have life.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: You will draw water joyfully from the springs of salvation.

readings.label: Sixth Reading
readings.text: Walk by the light of wisdom.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Lord, you have the words of everlasting life.

readings.label: Seventh Reading
readings.text: I will sprinkle clean water upon you.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Like a deer that longs for running streams, my soul longs for you, my God.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: The stone rejected by the builders has become the cornerstone.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: He has been raised from the dead.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: We are witnesses of all that he did.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: This is the day the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: Seek what is above, where Christ is seated.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Christ, our paschal lamb, has been sacrificed.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: He saw and believed.

title: Feast: Monday in the Octave of Easter

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: God raised this Jesus; of this we are all witnesses.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Keep me safe, O God; you are my hope.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: This is the day the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Go tell my brothers to go to Galilee.

title: Feast: Tuesday in the Octave of Easter

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Repent and be baptized, every one of you.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The earth is full of the goodness of the Lord.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: This is the day the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: I have seen the Lord.

title: Feast: Wednesday in the Octave of Easter

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Peter took him by the right hand and raised him up.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Rejoice, O hearts that seek the Lord.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: This is the day the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: He was made known to them in the breaking of the bread.

title: Feast: Thursday in the Octave of Easter

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: God has glorified his servant Jesus.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: O Lord, our Lord, how glorious is your name!

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: This is the day the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Thus it is written that the Christ would suffer and rise from the dead.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Peace to all of you who are in Christ.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: For ever I will sing the goodness of the Lord.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: If then you were raised with Christ, seek what is above.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Go into the whole world and proclaim the Gospel to every creature.

title: Feast: Saturday in the Octave of Easter

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: We cannot but speak about what we have seen and heard.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: I will give thanks to you, for you have answered me.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: This is the day the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Go into the whole world and proclaim the Gospel to every creature.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: All who believed were together and had all things in common.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: You rejoice with an indescribable and glorious joy.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Blessed are those who have not seen and have believed.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Peace be with you. As the Father has sent me, so I send you.

title: Feast: Ordinary Weekday/Peter Chanel, Priest, Martyr/Louis Grignion de Montfort, Priest

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: They were all filled with the Holy Spirit and continued to speak the word of God with boldness.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Blessed are all who take refuge in the Lord.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I am the light of the world, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: No one can see the kingdom of God without being born from above.

title: Memorial: Catherine of Siena, Virgin, Doctor

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: The community of believers was of one heart and mind.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord is king; he is robed in majesty.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: We have come to know and to believe in the love God has for us.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: So must the Son of Man be lifted up.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Go and take your place in the temple area, and tell the people everything about this life.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord hears the cry of the poor.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: The Lord sent me to bring glad tidings to the poor.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: God so loved the world that he gave his only Son.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: We must obey God rather than men.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord hears the cry of the poor.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I give you a new commandment: love one another.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: He who comes from above is above all.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: They left rejoicing that they had been found worthy to suffer for the name.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord is my light and my salvation.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: This is the day the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Jesus feeds the five thousand.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Last of all, he appeared to me.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Their message goes out through all the earth.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I am the way and the truth and the life.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Whoever has seen me has seen the Father.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: God raised Jesus; of this we are all witnesses.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: You will show me the path to life.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: You were ransomed with the precious blood of Christ.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Were not our hearts burning within us while he spoke to us?

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: He was made known to them in the breaking of the bread.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Stephen worked great wonders and signs among the people.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Remove from me the way of falsehood.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: One does not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes forth from the mouth of God.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Do not work for food that perishes but for the food that endures.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Lord, do not hold this sin against them.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Into your hands I commend my spirit.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: One does not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes forth from the mouth of God.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: I am the bread of life.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Philip went down to the city of Samaria and proclaimed the Christ to them.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Let all the earth cry out to God with joy.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I give you a new commandment: love one another.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: This is the will of my Father, that everyone who sees the Son and believes in him may have eternal life.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Philip proclaimed Jesus to the Ethiopian.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Blessed be God who refused me not my prayer or his kindness!

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: My sheep hear my voice, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: I am the living bread that came down from heaven.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Saul is converted and baptized.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Go out to all the world and tell the Good News.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood remains in me and I in him.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: My flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.

title: Feast: Ordinary Weekday/John of Ávila, Priest, Doctor

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Peter raised Tabitha from the dead.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: I will take the cup of salvation, and call on the name of the Lord.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood remains in me and I in him.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Repent and be baptized, every one of you.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord is my shepherd; there is nothing I shall want.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: By his wounds you have been healed.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I am the good shepherd, says the Lord; I know my sheep, and mine know me.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: I am the gate for the sheep.

title: Feast: Ordinary Weekday/Nereus and Achilleus, Martyrs/Pancras, Martyr

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: God has granted life-giving repentance to the Gentiles too.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Athirst is my soul for the living God.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: One does not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes forth from the mouth of God.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.

title: Feast: Ordinary Weekday/Our Lady of Fatima

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: It was in Antioch that the disciples were first called Christians.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Glorious things are told of you, O city of God!

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: My sheep hear my voice, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: I give them eternal life, and they shall never perish.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Matthias was added to the eleven apostles.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord will give him a seat with the leaders of his people.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I chose you from the world, to go and bear fruit.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Love one another as I love you.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: God raised up David as king.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: For ever I will sing the goodness of the Lord.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I give you a new commandment: love one another.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Whoever receives the one I send receives me.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: God fulfilled his promise by raising Jesus.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: You are my Son; this day I have begotten you.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: If then you were raised with Christ, seek what is above.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: I am the way and the truth and the life.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: The word of the Lord continued to spread through the whole region.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: All the ends of the earth have seen the saving power of God.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I am the way and the truth and the life.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Whoever has seen me has seen the Father.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: They chose Stephen, a man filled with faith and the Holy Spirit.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Lord, let your mercy be on us, as we place our trust in you.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: You are a chosen race, a royal priesthood.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I am the way and the truth and the life.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: I am in the Father and the Father is in me.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: We are proclaiming good news to you.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Not to us, O Lord, but to your name give glory.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: The Holy Spirit will teach you everything.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Whoever loves me will keep my word.

title: Feast: Ordinary Weekday/Bernardine of Siena, Priest

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: They strengthened the spirits of the disciples.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Your friends make known, O Lord, the glorious splendor of your kingdom.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: The Holy Spirit will teach you everything.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Do not let your hearts be troubled or afraid.

title: Feast: Ordinary Weekday/Christopher Magallanes, Priest, and Companions, Martyrs

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Paul and Barnabas went up to Jerusalem to the apostles and presbyters.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Let us go rejoicing to the house of the Lord.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I call you my friends, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: I am the vine, you are the branches.

title: Feast: Ordinary Weekday/Rita of Cascia, Religious

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: We believe that we are saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Proclaim God's marvelous deeds to all the nations.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Remain in me, as I remain in you, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Remain in my love.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: They sent a letter to the brothers in Antioch.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: I will praise you among the peoples, O Lord.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: The Spirit of truth will guide you to all truth.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: This I command you: love one another.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Come over to Macedonia and help us.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Serve the Lord with gladness.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: The Spirit of truth will guide you to all truth.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: If the world hates you, realize that it hated me first.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: He was lifted up, and a cloud took him from their sight.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: God mounts his throne to shouts of joy.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: He put all things beneath his feet.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Go and teach all nations, says the Lord; I am with you always.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Go, therefore, and make disciples of all nations.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: The Lord opened her heart to pay attention to what Paul was saying.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord takes delight in his people.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: The Spirit of truth will guide you to all truth.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: The Spirit of truth will testify to me.

title: Feast: Ordinary Weekday/Augustine of Canterbury, Bishop

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Believe in the Lord Jesus and you and your household will be saved.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Your right hand saves me, O Lord.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: The Spirit will convict the world in regard to sin and righteousness.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: If I do not go, the Advocate will not come to you.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: What you unknowingly worship, I proclaim to you.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: He has lifted up the horn of his people.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: The Spirit of truth will guide you to all truth.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: He will take from what is mine and declare it to you.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Paul stayed with them and worked, for they were tentmakers by trade.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: The Lord has revealed to the nations his saving power.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: I will not leave you orphans, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: You will grieve, but your grief will become joy.

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: Do not be afraid. Go on speaking, and do not be silent.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: God is king of all the earth.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: The Spirit of truth will testify to me, says the Lord.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Your hearts will rejoice, and no one will take your joy away from you.

title: Feast: Visitation of the Blessed Virgin Mary

readings.label: First Reading
readings.text: The Lord, your God, is in your midst, a mighty savior.

readings.label: Psalm
readings.text: Among you is the great and Holy One of Israel.

readings.label: Second Reading
readings.text: Rejoice with those who rejoice, weep with those who weep.

readings.label: Alleluia
readings.text: Blessed are you, O Virgin Mary, who believed that what was spoken to you by the Lord would be fulfilled.

readings.label: Gospel
readings.text: Mary set out and traveled to the hill country in haste.
